Mary came from the tribe of Judah. There are two lines described in the gospels: that of Mary and that of Joseph. Both came from the line of King David, but they diverged from there. Joseph wasn't involved in the birth of Jesus, but all of their remaining children were in the line of the tribe of Judah, as well, which here in America is almost totally ignored because of the gentile-centrist attitude of the American churches.

Mary is from the Tribe of Judah. So was Joseph. Both are from the family of David. Mary was descended from Solomon, I do believe. Joseph, on the other hand, was descended from one of David’s other sons. Joseph and Mary’s other (at least) 6 children were of the same lineage. Jesus’ brothers were James, Joses, Simon and Judah. Scripture also mentions that Jesus had sisters.
